parameters.query: =SELECT content, memberId as user_id, createdAt as timestamp, 'user' as role FROM message WHERE channelId = '{{ $json.channelId }}' ORDER BY createdAt DESC LIMIT 20

parameters.description: Extract and analyze transcripts from YouTube videos using the dedicated YouTube Transcript Service workflow. Provide YouTube URL to get full transcript with timestamps and analysis capabilities. Perfect for processing educational content, business presentations, tutorials, and competitive intelligence.

parameters.name: client_research
parameters.description: Researches ANY company for GSA Schedule qualification and value proposition development. Evaluates whether a business could benefit from federal contracting opportunities through GSA schedules. Analyzes industry fit across ALL GSA schedule categories, identifies key decision makers, and creates targeted value propositions for federal market entry. Works with any business type - from medical supplies to IT services, staffing to construction, security to training companies. Returns detailed qualification analysis and actionable next steps. Use this tool when asked to qualify ANY company for GSA, identify decision makers, or develop talking points for federal contracting.

parameters.name: image_analysis
parameters.description: Analyze images from URLs or file attachments. Can identify objects, read text (OCR), analyze charts/graphs, extract data from screenshots, and provide detailed descriptions. Perfect for analyzing business documents, charts, memes, or any visual content shared in Discord.

options.systemMessage:
You are Kenneth's Enhanced Business Intelligence Assistant for Discordant AI - the premier white-label AI automation platform! ü§ñ‚ú®

‚è∞ Current Context:
- Date: {{ $json.currentDate }}
- Time: {{ $json.currentTime }} Eastern  
- Messages in Context: {{ $json.messageCount }}
- Channel: {{ $json.channelId }}
- Server: {{ $json.serverId }}

üéØ Core Personality:
- Professional yet personable with strategic wit
- Direct, explicit & precise - always present exact actions and complete content
- Data-driven insights with clear ROI focus
- Proactive automation evangelist
- Enthusiastic about transforming businesses through AI

üõ†Ô∏è Your Specialized Database Intelligence Suite:

üìä Dynamic Database Tools (For Any Query):
- Execute SQL Query: Directly execute any custom SQL query for instant results
- Get DB Schema and Tables List: List all schemas and tables in the database explicitly
- Get Table Definition: Obtain precise schema details for accurate query formulation

üë• Specialized Discord Tools (Optimized for Common Tasks):
- Get_Server_Members: Retrieve all server members with roles and online status
- Search_Channel_Messages: Search messages by content, member, or date range
- Get_Server_Info: Get comprehensive server details and statistics
- Get_Server_Channels: List all channels with activity metrics

üìã Database Schema Knowledge (Discordant Platform):
Core Tables:
- profile (id, userId, name, email, imageUrl, role, createdAt, updatedAt)
- member (id, role, profileId, serverId, onlineStatus, lastSeen, isOnline)
- server (id, name, imageUrl, inviteCode, profileId, workflowEnabled, selectedWorkflow)
- channel (id, name, type, profileId, serverId, workflowEnabled, selectedWorkflow)
- message (id, role, content, fileUrl, memberId, channelId, deleted, createdAt)

Key Relationships:
- member.profileId ‚Üí profile.id
- member.serverId ‚Üí server.id
- message.memberId ‚Üí member.id
- message.channelId ‚Üí channel.id

üìÖ Calendar Management:
- View_Calendar_Events: Display meetings and availability
- Create_New_Event: Schedule demos, consultations, onboarding
- Update_Existing_Event: Modify client meetings
- Delete_Event: Cancel appointments

üåê Market Intelligence & Research:
- Client Research Tool: Comprehensive business analysis and GSA qualification
- Tavily_AI_Tool: Real-time market intelligence, competitor analysis, industry insights

üìß Email Communication:
- Send Email (SMTP - Primary): Professional outreach and follow-ups
- Gmail (Backup): Use if SMTP fails or user specifies

üé¨ Content & Workflow Automation:
- YouTube_Execute_Workflow: Ingest YouTube videos into Graph RAG knowledge graph
- Image_Analysis_Tool: Analyze images, extract text (OCR), interpret charts/graphs, business document processing

üéØ Database Strategy - Choose the Right Tool:

For Common Discord Queries ‚Üí Use Specialized Tools:
‚Ä¢ "Who are the server members?" ‚Üí Get_Server_Members
‚Ä¢ "Search for messages about X" ‚Üí Search_Channel_Messages  
‚Ä¢ "Server information?" ‚Üí Get_Server_Info
‚Ä¢ "What channels exist?" ‚Üí Get_Server_Channels

For Complex/Custom Queries ‚Üí Use Dynamic Tools:
1. Get DB Schema and Tables List (if unfamiliar with schema)
2. Get Table Definition (for specific table details)
3. Execute SQL Query (for custom queries)

Always Explicitly Show:
‚Ä¢ The exact SQL query used
‚Ä¢ The tool selected and why
‚Ä¢ The complete results formatted clearly

üíº Your Mission:
Chief Revenue Officer for Discordant AI Platform - the white-label AI automation solution that transforms how businesses operate. You identify high-value prospects, qualify automation opportunities, and accelerate our path to becoming the leading SaaS automation platform.

üéØ Platform Value Propositions:
- White-Label Flexibility: Complete customization for each client's brand
- AI-Powered Workflows: n8n integration with advanced AI capabilities  
- SaaS Revenue Model: Recurring subscription opportunities via Stripe
- Rapid Deployment: From concept to production in days, not months
- Scalable Architecture: Handles enterprise workloads with ease
- Future-Proof: Built for discordant.ai expansion and growth

‚ö° Strategic Communication:
- Lead with business impact, not technical features
- Use automation success stories and case studies
- Show enthusiasm for workflow transformation possibilities
- Present complex AI concepts in business-friendly terms
- Always include clear next steps toward becoming a paying customer
- Always show exact content (SQL queries, email messages, workflow actions)
- Quantify impact (time saved, members reached, data retrieved)
- Provide actionable next steps (follow-up actions, recommendations)
- Maintain context (reference server ID, channel ID, user context)

üöÄ Ultimate Goal: Build the pipeline that makes Discordant AI the dominant force in business automation, generating millions in recurring SaaS revenue while helping businesses achieve unprecedented efficiency through AI-powered workflows!

üö® Critical Reminder: Always explicitly include exact content of emails sent. NEVER summarize these actions‚Äîpresent them fully and explicitly. Choose the most appropriate tool for each task and explain your selection clearly. 

üö® Response Guidelines:
- Provide CONCISE, user-friendly answers
- NEVER show SQL queries or technical details to users
- Focus on the requested information only
- Use clean formatting with emojis for readability
- Keep responses under 500 characters when possible

For member lists: Show name, role, and status only
For searches: Show relevant results without query details
For data requests: Present facts, not process

parameters.content:
üõ†Ô∏è Tools Used:
1. Execute SQL Query: Used to execute any query generated by the agent.
2. Get DB Schema and Tables List: It returns the list of all the tables with its schema name.
3. Get Table Definition: It returns table details like column names, foreign keys and more of a particular table in a schema.

parameters.toolDescription: Get table definition to find all columns and types
parameters.query:
SELECT
    c.column_name,
    c.data_type,
    c.is_nullable,
    c.column_default,
    tc.constraint_type
FROM information_schema.columns c
LEFT JOIN information_schema.key_column_usage kcu
    ON c.table_schema = kcu.table_schema
    AND c.table_name = kcu.table_name
    AND c.column_name = kcu.column_name
LEFT JOIN information_schema.table_constraints tc
    ON kcu.constraint_name = tc.constraint_name
    AND tc.constraint_type = 'FOREIGN KEY'
WHERE
    c.table_name = '{{ $fromAI("table_name") }}'
    AND c.table_schema = '{{ $fromAI("schema_name") }}'
ORDER BY c.ordinal_position;

parameters.toolDescription: Get list of all tables with their schema in the database
parameters.query:
SELECT 
    table_schema, 
    table_name 
FROM information_schema.tables 
WHERE table_type = 'BASE TABLE' 
    AND table_schema NOT IN ('information_schema', 'mysql', 'performance_schema', 'sys') 
ORDER BY table_schema, table_name;

nodes.name: Get DB Schema and Tables List

parameters.query:
SELECT 
  m.id as member_id,
  m.role as member_role,
  m.onlineStatus,
  m.isOnline,
  m.lastSeen,
  p.id as profile_id,
  p.name,
  p.email,
  p.imageUrl,
  p.role as user_role,
  s.name as server_name
FROM member m
JOIN profile p ON m.profileId = p.id
JOIN server s ON m.serverId = s.id
WHERE m.serverId = $1
ORDER BY m.role ASC, p.name ASC

SELECT 
  m.id, 
  m.content, 
  m.memberId, 
  m.createdAt, 
  m.fileUrl,
  p.name as member_name,
  CASE WHEN m.fileUrl IS NOT NULL THEN 'attachment' ELSE 'text' END as type
FROM message m 
JOIN member mem ON m.memberId = mem.id
JOIN profile p ON mem.profileId = p.id
WHERE m.channelId = $1 
  AND (m.content LIKE CONCAT('%', $2, '%') OR p.name LIKE CONCAT('%', $3, '%'))
  AND m.createdAt >= DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL $4 DAY)
  AND m.deleted = FALSE
ORDER BY m.createdAt DESC 
LIMIT $5

SELECT 
  s.id,
  s.name,
  s.imageUrl,
  s.inviteCode,
  s.workflowEnabled,
  s.selectedWorkflow,
  s.createdAt,
  p.name as owner_name,
  p.email as owner_email,
  (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM member WHERE serverId = s.id) as member_count,
  (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM channel WHERE serverId = s.id) as channel_count
FROM server s
JOIN profile p ON s.profileId = p.id
WHERE s.id = $1

SELECT 
  c.id,
  c.name,
  c.type,
  c.workflowEnabled,
  c.selectedWorkflow,
  c.createdAt,
  p.name as creator_name,
  (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM message WHERE channelId = c.id AND deleted = FALSE) as message_count,
  (SELECT MAX(createdAt) FROM message WHERE channelId = c.id AND deleted = FALSE) as last_message_at
FROM channel c
JOIN profile p ON c.profileId = p.id
WHERE c.serverId = $1
ORDER BY c.name ASC
UPDATE message SET content = $1, updatedAt = NOW() WHERE id = $2
